Cari amici, this film will run through next Tuesday, July 26th. So there will be plenty of opportunity to see it.

Start the chatter now and maybe we can get a group/groups to go on a certain night.

 

This movie has subtitles in English -

General Admission is $8.00 

 

(Italy, 2011) Directed by Giuseppe Capotondi. Written by Alessandro Fabbri, Ludovica Rampoldi and Stefano Sardo. Cast: Ksenia Rappoport, Filippo Timi, Antonia Truppo, Gaetano Bruno. The best mystery to come out of Europe since Tell No One is a twist-filled thriller that won Best Actor and Best Actress Awards at the Venice Film Festival for its two stars, Fillippo Timi and Ksenia Rappoport. The Double Hour takes its title from those times of the day like 10:10 (or, since it’s set in Italy, 23:23), when you can make a wish and it will come true. Which may or may not be accurate, like much of the narrative puzzle that kicks off when the brand new love affair between an ex-cop and a Slovakian hotel chambermaid in Turin plunges into (what may be) murder. “A beautiful, head-spinning mystery that requires keen attention - and rewards it with a tricky and poetic payoff.” Steven Rea, Philadelphia Inquirer.
item.name: Cinestudio presents "The Double Hour" (La Doppia Ora)
